questions.text: A lady wants LASIK surgery for her daughter. She asks for your opinion; all the following things are suitable for performing LASIK-EXCEPT:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Age of 15 years The minimum age for any refractive surgery should be at least 18 years . Till 18, the vision of people with myopia changes Thus, the person should at least attain 18 years of age before opting for LASIK surgery. Although there is no upper age limit for LASIK surgery, the eyes of people above 40 years old may have presbyopia , which prevents them from seeing close objects.

Contraindications include unstable refractive error, active collagen vascular disease (especially in the presence of iritis or scleritis), pregnancy , presence of a pacemaker, any ongoing active inflammation of the external eye (g., conjunctivitis, severe dry eye), and a refractive error outside the range of laser correction, age less than 18 years. Other contraindications include leaving less than a calculated residual bed of 250 µm of untouched cornea and signs, symptoms, or topographic findings consistent with keratoconus.

options.text: Patient A is undergoing Epi-LASIK surgery.

options.label: B
options.text: Patient B is undergoing extra-stromal corneal ring placement.

options.label: C
options.text: Patient A is undergoing LASEK surgery.

questions.correct_answer: A. Patient A is undergoing Epi-LASIK surgery.
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Patient A is undergoing Epi-LASIK surgery. In the given question, as described, it is clear that- Patient A is undergoing Epi-LASIK surgery in which Epikeratome is used instead of alcohol in LASEK. It provides the advantage of less pain, less corneal haziness and early healing. Patient B is undergoing Intrastromal corneal ring placement, not extrastromal (so option B is correct). Hence the correct answer is only option A.

questions.text: A 23-year-old male with difficulty in vision on evaluation was found to have astigmatism and the following sign, as given in the image below. He was posted for surgery, where riboflavin drops were put in the eye, followed by exposure to UV rays. Which of the following is the procedure he is undergoing?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Collagen cross-linkage. In the given question, as described, the patient is having keratoconus . The collagen cross-linkage procedure is very useful in this, After anesthesia , 8-9mm of corneal epithelium is scrapped off. After this, we add riboflavin 1% every 2 min for 30 minutes to the eye. After this, UV rays are focused on the stroma for 30 mins. A saline wash is given.BCL is applied.

questions.text: A 34-year-old man wants to undergo refractive surgery for myopia. He is scheduled for epikeratophakia. Before the surgery, he would like to understand the procedure better. Which of the following correctly describes this technique of refractive surgery?

options.label: B

options.label: D
options.text: Attachment of a donor corneal tissue over the host cornea

questions.correct_answer: D. Attachment of a donor corneal tissue over the host cornea
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Attachment of a donor corneal tissue over the host cornea Epikeratophakia is a type of refractive to modify the cornea's refractive power. In this, a donor corneal tissue is attached to the host cornea after removal of the epithelium.

Highyeild:

Indications of Epikeratophakia : Treatment of Keratoconus Refractive errors like myopia and high hypermetropia, including aphakia, cannot be corrected with conservative methods.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option: A . The corneal tissue is resected, modified in shape, and replaced in a procedure called keratomileusis. Option: B. Raising the superficial flap of the epithelium to ablate the stroma bed is done in laser-assisted in situ keratomileusis or LASIK procedure. The superficial, circular hinged epithelium flap and stroma are created with an automated, sharp blade called a The hinged flap is lifted, and the stromal bed is ablated with a laser to precisely sculpt the cornea to the desired extent, following which the flap is reposited without sutures. Option: C. The cornea's surface is ablated by laser in the procedure called photorefractive keratectomy (PRK), a type of excimer laser refractive surgery. This results in a flatter cornea to neutralise myopia.

Extraedge:

Common Complications of epikeratophakia include delayed postoperative visual recovery reduced best-corrected visual acuity prolonged epithelial defects irregular astigmatism
